formerly: [[Elves]] and [[Men]] | created= | destroyed= | events= | gallery=the Tower Hills }} The '''Tower Hills''' ([[Sindarin|Sind.]] ''Emyn Beraid'') were a range of hills at the [[Westmarch|west end]] of [[Eriador]]. They lay east of [[Grey Havens|Mithlond]], the Grey Havens of [[Lindon]], and west of the [[Far Downs]], of old the border of [[the Shire]]. High upon the Tower Hills stood three tall [[Elves|Elven]] towers, the [[White Towers]], the highest of which was called ''[[Elostirion]]'', which held a ''[[Palantíri|Palantír]]'',{{UT|Palantiri}}, Note 2 before Cirdan removed it to the [[White Ship]]. ==History== Although [[Gil-galad]]'s kingdom did not have clear bounds south of the [[Lune]], the [[Elves of Lindon]] maintained an outpost there.{{PM|Atani}} In {{SA|600}}, when the first ship of the [[Númenóreans]] sailed up the [[Gulf of Lune]] there was a meeting between the men from the sea and their [[Middle Men|distant kinsmen]] in the Hills.{{UT|Wife}} The White Towers upon the Tower Hills were built before the end of the [[Second Age]] by [[Gil-galad]] for his friend [[Elendil]].{{S|Rings}} During the [[Third Age]], [[Wandering Companies|bands of Elves]] would go in pilgrimage to Elostirion in order to have a glimpse of the West through the [[Elostirion-stone]].{{FR|Three}} The Stone remained in its tower until the end of the Age; it was then taken back into the West.{{RK|Havens}} In {{FoA|31}}, the [[Westmarch]] was added to [[the Shire]], making the Tower Hills the new western border of the land. Three years later [[Thain]] [[Peregrin Took|Peregrin I]] made [[Fastred of Greenholm]] the first Warden of Westmarch. He and his wife [[Elanor Gardner|Elanor]], daughter of [[Samwise Gamgee]], moved to the Tower Hills and founded the town of [[Undertowers]] on the eastern slopes.{{App|Later}} ==Etymology== The name ''Emyn Beraid'' is [[Sindarin]] for "Tower Hills", from ''[[amon|emyn]]'' ("hills") and ''[[barad|beraid]]'' ("towers").{{S|Appendix}}, entries ''amon'' and ''barad'' ==Other versions of the legendarium== According to J.R.R. Tolkien's [[Unfinished index]] for ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' the towers on the Hills were reputed to have been built by the elves, but they were actually built by Elendil.{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Tower Hills'', p. 28 ==Portrayal in adaptations== [[File:War in Middle Earth - The White Towers.png|thumb|left|A screenshot from ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien's War in Middle Earth]]'']] '''1988: ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien's War in Middle Earth]]'':''' :The Towers Hills are one of the battlegrounds in this game.
